title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Thursday 12 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: ranieri sends condolences to graham taylor 's family .
roadworks put businesses at risk of closure .
new owner of donington park circuit .
plans unveiled for jewry wall £ 7m revamp .
ndidi expected to make premier league debut .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live - updates will start again on friday morning .

documents.title: weather : cold with some snow
text: very cold overnight and a few evening snow showers are possible .
temperatures will drop quickly below freezing so ice will form on untreated surfaces where roads are wet from earlier rain .
a band of sleet and snow will briefly pass through just before dawn with lows of -1c ( 30f ) .
early sleet and snow on friday will soon clear , leaving a dry day with a good deal of sunshine .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest headlines for leicestershire
text: latest headlines for leicestershire
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: interactive gritting map
text: the county county has a rather helpful map on their website showing what roads they grit and how highly prioritised they are .
check the roads near you here .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lineker 'eternally grateful ' to taylor
text: in another tweet about graham taylor the match of the day presenter said : `` he made me his england captain and i will be eternally grateful to him for giving me that honour . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lineker tribute to graham taylor
text: very sad news that graham taylor has passed away .
an outstanding manager , lover of football and thoroughly decent man .
sad scum like u just hide behind screens and abuse others .
u never do it to people 's faces !
gutless thick idiots !
bye
graham taylor did more wonderful things for football than anyone else around today rip
enjoying binge watching gt coaching the england squad including gazza and yourself rip graham taylor
is he ok ?
he 's fucking dead
funny how every other player has paid tribute to him on tv apart from you , and motd do n't count that 's in your contract .
it 's very sad at such a young age these days , my thoughts go to his family and friends rip
ripgt .
great character .
should n't have subbed you but that 's history .
how very two faced of you gary # watfordfc
for yesrs gary is on record saying he has not forgiven him then he skips match of the day to avoid saying anything
@ twitterid gary how did you get in with him as manager ?
nice comments @ twitterid although it was the end of an amazing england career
, very sad , may he rest in peace , great football man .
what he did at watford was incredible !
never knew he took them from 4th division to 2nd in first division .
world class manager .
and did it a second time !
division two-division one-premier league in three seasons ! !
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: first leicestershire snow of 2017 ?
text: leigh spencer has tweeted us this video showing snow falling in newbold vernon
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: plans to build 60 homes on flooded clay pit
text: protesters turned out in force ahead of a public consultation on developing hinckley 's the big pit .
author: Hinckley Times

documents.title: your photos : cows in melton
text: uploaded last night by pete in melton mowbray
i hope you had some wellies on - very muddy .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: where is england 's steepest residential street ?
text: this is a good bit of fun - the bbc is trying to find the steepest residential street in england .
can you think of any contenders in leicestershire ?
this is the one in new zealand that has been officially named as the world 's steepest residential road
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ndidi premier league debut expected
text: so who is expected to play for the foxes tomorrow ?
well ranieri said andy king was fine to play and jamie vardy has trained regularly this week .
ulloa will have to wait a little longer - he 's suffering with a thigh problem .
wilfred ndidi is expected to make his premier league debut against chelsea .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: listen : unhappy schlupp can leave leicester
text: claudio ranieri confirms jeffrey schlupp has told leicester he wants to leave the club
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: swapping big serves for slam dunks
text: former junior grand slam winner joshua ward-hibbert is now determined to star on the basketball court with leicester riders .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: former charnwood mp on nhs funding row
text: a former conservative health secretary has said it was unfair for downing street to hint that the nhs england boss , simon stevens , was to blame for the winter crisis gripping the health service .
author: The Guardian

documents.title: warning about ice
text: the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for ice in leicester overnight .
it 's thought that between midnight and 11:00 tomorrow ( friday ) ice is expected to form on untreated surfaces .
there could also be some outbreaks of sleet and snow .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ranieri : schlupp 'not happy '
text: talking about the suggestion jeff schlupp could be planning to leave the club , the foxes boss said : i spoke with him , he spoke with the club , he 's not happy .
i said if he wants to go he can go , the money is important . ''
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: ranieri tribute to former england boss
text: claudio ranieri has commented on the death of graham taylor at his leicester city press conference .
he said : `` very very sad , my condolences to his family and all the football world ''
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: plenty of rain around , there could be a bit of snow for a time too .
most of any snow will fall mainly over higher ground with most areas seeing rain instead - highs of 5c ( 41f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: your comments : jewry wall investment
text: `` with the recent , and previous , store closures i think soulsby has got it absolutely right to focus on making the town centre a place to visit and attract tourists for reasons other than shopping .
`` there is absolutely no point in getting shops to invest outside the highcross and fosse park .
re-developing the jewry wall attraction , alongside the work done on the market area , king richard iii centre , jubilee square are exactly the right things to do . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : underpass closed
text: in # leicester the southgates underpass is closed from the magazine towards vaughan way due to an # accident .
div via st nicholas circle
now cleared and re-open .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ranieri speaking to the media
text: it 's back to the premier league for leicester city after their exploits in the fa cup last weekend .
claudio ranieri is due to speak to us journalists shortly
i 'm sure there will be questions thrown at him about the january transfer window but i 'm not sure how much he 'll say on the subject .
it 's also the return of n'golo kante on saturday - i hope he gets the reception he deserves .
author: Jason Bourne
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: revamp aimed at tourists
text: we 've now got so many visitors coming to leicester that we need to think about how we can make jewry wall into a visitor centre of national significance , which would give people another reason to come and spend money in the city .
we 've commissioned a company to look at how we can achieve this .
they have come up with some very interesting ideas , but they are just ideas at this stage . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: multimillion-pound museum revamp
text: the plan is to have an interactive display on the roman invasion and occupation of leicester .
it would show how soldiers and traders from across the mediterranean and north africa settled in the city .
it 's thought the whole fit-out could cost the council about £ 7m .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'world class ' visitor centre
text: here is what the new jewry wall museum entrance could look like
the city council says the transform could make the visitor centre `` world-class '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ideas for museum revamp
text: the city council has released some early design ideas for the revamped jewry wall museum .
this is what the hall could look like
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: healthwatch urges people to consider a & e alternatives
text: the organisation healthwatch leicestershire is sending out a message after leicester hospitals declared a `` system critical incident '' earlier in the week .
it 's asking the public to use alternative services to the emergency department where possible .
chairman rick moore said : if it is not an emergency , please call nhs 111 .
people can be seen by an experienced nurse , without an appointment at one of the eight urgent care centres , walk-in centres and minor injuries units across leicester , leicestershire and rutland .
`` local pharmacies also play an important role for on-the-spot advice and remedies . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : volunteers improve melton country park
text: does n't melton country park look beautiful today ?
it 's the work of a volunteer group called friends of melton country park .
if you fancy getting involved in a spot of gardening they 're looking for more helpers - contact melton borough council for more information .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : tourist attraction ?
text: this is one of the largest remaining roman masonry structures in britain and is the only element of the roman town of ratae coritanorum to survive .
it was built in about ad 160 and formed the entrance to the public baths .
how much of that did you know before now ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: big plans for jewry wall
text: jewry wall in leicester - not one of the most exciting bits of history you 've probably seen
this could soon change as the city council has plans to turn it into a major visitor attraction .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : villages to share compensation
text: county councillor trevor pendleton explains where the compensation will go

documents.title: compensation for new rail-road transport hub
text: villages affected by the building of this east midlands gateway hub are to receive a share of £ 300,000 of compensation .
building has begun at the site just north of east midlands airport .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new owners plan 'great new era for donington '
text: `` i am thrilled that msv has now acquired the donington circuit business .

donington has incredible history , being the first permanent road circuit in the country and the only circuit upon which the mighty pre-war auto unions and mercedes grand prix cars raced in the 1930s .

we plan a great new era for donington , with some exciting new events and much enhanced quality of experience for all of its customers , whether spectators , competitors and track day participants , together with even better value . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new owners for donington park
text: donington park has new owners - it 's been bought by the company motorsport vision .
msv is owned by the former f1 driver jonathan palmer and sir peter ogden - they already own brands hatch , oulton park , snetterton and cadwell park .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged with ashby attack
text: a 34-year-old man has been charged following an attack in ashby on new year 's day that left the victim with a fractured eye socket and spine .
andrew forster , from malvern crescent in ashby , has been charged with grievous bodily harm , actual bodily harm and breach of a restraining order .
he 's due to appear at leicester magistrates ' court this morning .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police find stolen harley davidson
text: police in new parks send out a warning to motor cycle owners after a harley davidson was stolen
one stolen harley davidson recovered this morning by your local beat team .
make sure your motor cycles are locked & secured when unattended
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: not a 'real crime '
text: the reasons behind why people hit and run are complex but by breaking drivers down into categories we start to understand their motivations for leaving the scene of an accident .
interestingly , there seems to be a public perception that motoring offences are not 'real crimes ' and therefore there is a tendency for drivers to justify their behaviour . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drivers explain why they did n't stop
text: so why do drivers fail to stop after an accident ?
the university found a large number of people did n't think the incident was serious enough to report or were unaware of the legal requirement to report it .
this was based on data collected in a survey of 695 people who had been convicted of committing a `` hit and run '' offence .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: university studies 'hit and run ' crashes
text: scientists at the university of leicester have been looking into why `` hit and run '' drivers fail to stop after an accident .
just over 12 % of crashes reported to the police where someone is injured are caused by a `` hit and run '' driver .
this is the second year in a row that figure has increased .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: club getting daily calls for gymnastics lessons
text: this is coalville gymnastics club , which is also at full capacity and has 500 names on its waiting list
melanie jakowski is the club chairwoman and said they need more funding to expand the facilities and invest in more coaching .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: long wait for gymnastics lessons
text: children across the county are facing long waits to join a gymnastics club .
waiting lists in our area are becoming longer and longer - .
this club in the city has 2,000 people waiting for a place
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: making the headlines
text: today 's front page - read the main story here .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: snow heading to leicestershire
text: potential for some snow later on today in the east midlands , particularly in southern parts and then again overnight .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: council defends £ 1.6m market project
text: mike dalzell from leicester city council has been defending the building project on market place .
he compared it to going to the dentist with the attitude of `` no pain , no gain '' .
he said : `` at the end it 's going to be a lot better . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: watch : east midlands weather forecast
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: trader hoping for financial help
text: another trader affected by the roadworks is peter gadsby who runs a framing business .
he told bbc radio leicester : `` it 's never been as bad as this .
we 've had to make people redundant , we 've had to reduce hours , we 've reduced wages just enabling us to keep the doors open . ''
he 's hoping the council will be able to offer some financial help .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shoppers avoiding market area
text: before the work began anne said she was taking about £ 700 on a saturday .
now she 's taking about £ 70 and is worried she 'll soon have to close the store after 11 years of trading .
shoppers told bbc radio leicester they have been avoiding the area because of the noise and `` unsafe '' access .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: customers avoid roadworks
text: this work and disruption might be annoying for us shoppers but for some traders it 's actually having an impact on business .
like this milkshake shop
anne fox is the owner and told bbc radio leicester she 's had to lay off all of her staff .
she said : `` when they 've been doing this pavement it 's been horrendous .
every day thick dust , noise , ca n't hear yourself speak .
today i 've only had one customer . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: overrun market works
text: if you 've visited the market in leicester recently chances are you 've been faced with this obstacle course
not ideal and it seems to have been going on for some time now .
well , the work to turn the site of the old indoor market into a pedestrianised square has actually overrun - it should have been finished before christmas .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes press conference
text: claudio ranieri is due to hold his pre-chelsea press conference today - all the key quotes and headlines on local live from 13:00 .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: listen : tigers ' recruitment 'more difficult '
text: leicester tigers ' head coach has said they may face challenges with player recruitment
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello leicestershire - is anyone else a little excited at the prospect of some snow today ?
last night when i checked the forecast it said `` heavy snow '' at about 16:00 but we 'll get a full weather report soon from charlie slater .
as well as the weather i 'll be keeping you up to date with all the news , sport and travel throughout the day here on local live .
if you want to get in touch you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
